properties.name: Emergency Warning
properties.webBody:
This Emergency Warning is being issued for Mafeking, Watgania. 
  • There is a bushfire in the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling from the Grampians National Park in an easterly direction towards Watgania and Mafeking. 
  • Watgania & Mafeking could be impacted anytime within the next one hour.
Leaving immediately is the safest option, before conditions become too dangerous. 

Emergency services may not be able to help you if you decide to stay.
What you should do: 

Travel to: 
  • The home of family or friends that is away from the warning area.
  • When you leave remember to take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger.

In the car: 
  • If you are travelling, do not enter the area. Make a u-turn and travel to safety.
  • Slow down and turn on your headlights. Smoke will make it difficult to see.

If you are unable to leave you should shelter indoors:
  • Close all exterior doors, windows and vents. Turn off cooling systems.
  • You must take shelter before the fire arrives. The extreme heat is likely to kill you well before the flames reach you.
  • Shelter in a room that has two exits, such as a door or window including one directly to the outside. It is important to be able to see outside so you know what is happening with the fire. 
  • If your home catches on fire and the conditions inside become unbearable, you need to get out and go to an area that has already been burnt. 

If you cannot get indoors, other last resort options include:
  • Shelter in the middle of a large open area like a ploughed paddock, football oval or sporting reserve.
  • Get into a large body of water like a dam, lake, river, the ocean or inground pool.
  • Try to protect yourself from the fire's heat.

If you are caught in fire in your car:
  • Park behind a solid structure to block the fire's heat or pull over to cleared area.
  • Try to position the car towards the approaching fire.
  • Turn on your hazard lights and headlights.
  • Close all windows.
  • Turn off the air-conditioning and shut all the air vents.
  • Turn your car engine off.
  • Get down as low as possible below window level and cover up with a pure woollen blanket.
Impacts in your area: 
  • You will be able to use Yarram Gap road to leave. It is closed to incoming traffic. 
Road Closures: 
  •  Andrews Lane at Moyston-Willaura North intersection. 
  •  Toora Road at Red Hill Road intersection Moyston-Dunkeld Road at Rifle Range Road intersection. 
  • Moyston-Dunkeld Road at Rifle Range Road intersection.
  • Powell's Lane at Stavely, is closed to all north bound traffic.
  • Helens Road Stavely,  is closed to all north bound traffic.
  • Grampians Tourist Road is closed from Bellfield entrance to the southern Victoria Valley Road intersection.  
  •  Victoria Valley Road is closed at the Victoria Point intersection. 
  • Yarram Gap Road is closed from Grampians Tourist Road to Parrie-Yalloak Road.    
Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

 Relief Centre Now Open:    
  •  Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat 
This messages was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 20/12/2024 05:10 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Pioneer Bay, The Gurdies, Grantville, Woodleigh
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Grantville, Pioneer Bay, The Gurdies, Woodleigh.

  • There is a bushfire at Woodland Close The Gurdies that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling from Sand Supplies in The Gurdies towards Woodland Close off Gurdies St Helier Road.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • Find information on protecting yourself and your family: www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/before-and-during-a-fire 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Bulldozers, aircraft and firefighters are operating in the area.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 20/12/2024 08:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.location: Cavendish, Hensley Park, Karabeal, Victoria Point
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Cavendish, Hensley Park, Karabeal, Victoria Point.

  • There is a grassfire at E Walters Rd, Karabeal that is now under control.
  • This Advice message is an update to the earlier Watch & Act issued at 2:07 today.
  • Fire fighters are on scene and will remain active in the area for several hours. 
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. Find information on protecting yourself and your family: https://www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/am-i-at-risk/grassfires-rural.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are attending to this fire. 
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 20/12/2024 05:30 pm or as the situation changes.

properties.name: Emergency Warning
properties.webBody:
This Emergency Warning is being issued for The Gurdies.

  • There is a bushfire at Woodland Close , The Gurdies that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling from Sand Supplies in a easterly direction towards Gurdies St Helier Road and Stewart Road. 
  • The fire in the Woodlands area has increased in fire spread on the eastern side
  • This fire is threatening homes and lives.
  • It is too late to leave the area safely so you must take shelter now.
  • This bushfire could impact The Gurdies St. Helier Road between Woodland Close and Stewart Road and Stewart Road from Gurdies St. Helier Road to Dunbabbin Road and Bergmeier Road any time between 3pm and 5pm.
You are in danger and need to act immediately to survive.

The safest option is to take shelter indoors immediately. It is too late to leave.
What you should do:
You should move indoors: 
  • Protect yourself by wearing long sleeves and trousers, made from pure cotton or wool. Wear leather boots.  
  • Bring your pets inside.  
  • Close all exterior doors, windows and vents and turn off cooling systems. 
  • You must take shelter before the fire arrives. The extreme heat is likely to kill you well before the flames reach you. 
  • Shelter in a room that has two exits, such as a door or window including one directly to the outside. It is important to be able to see outside so you know what is happening with the fire.

If your home catches on fire: 
  • Move away from the rooms that are on fire, closing doors behind you.
  • As soon as the bushfire has passed the house, or conditions inside become unbearable, you need to get out and go to an area that has already been burnt. Staying inside a burning building will almost certainly end in death. 
  • It may still be too hot to remain outside, so you will need to seek shelter in another structure or last resort option.

If you cannot get indoors, last resort options include:
  • Shelter in the middle of a large open area like a ploughed paddock, football oval or sporting reserve.
  • Get into a large body of water like a dam, lake, river, the ocean or inground pool.
  • Try to protect yourself from the fire's heat.

If you are travelling: 
  • If you are travelling, do not enter the warning area. Make a u-turn and travel to safety. 
  • If you are currently driving slow down and turn on your headlights. Smoke will make it difficult to see.

If you are caught in fire in your car: 
  • Park off the road behind a solid structure to block the fire's heat or pull over to cleared area.
  • Try to position the car towards the approaching fire.
  • Turn on your hazard lights and headlights.
  • Close all windows. 
  • Turn off the air-conditioning and shut all the air vents. 
  • Turn your car engine off. 
  • Get down as low as possible below window level and cover up with a pure woollen blanket.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Embers are starting small fires ahead of the main fire.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 20/12/2024 05:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

- There is a bushfire at Woodland Close , The Gurdies that is not yet under control.
- The bushfire is travelling from Sand Supplies in a easterly direction towards Gurdies St Helier Road and Stewart Road. 
- The fire in the Woodlands area has increased in fire spread on the eastern side
- This fire is threatening homes and lives.
- It is too late to leave the area safely so you must take shelter now.
- This bushfire could impact The Gurdies St. Helier Road between Woodland Close and Stewart Road and Stewart Road from Gurdies St. Helier Road to Dunbabbin Road and Bergmeier Road any time between 3pm and 5pm.


        You are in danger and need   to act immediately to survive.

The safest option is to take   shelter indoors immediately. It is too late to leave.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Cabbage Tree, Dean, Wattle Flat, Chapel Flat, Clarkes Hill, Glen Park, Springmount
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Cabbage Tree, Chapel Flat, Clarkes Hill, Dean, Glen Park, Springmount, Wattle Flat.

  • There is a bushfire at Melbourne Rd, Creswick that is contained.
  • There is low-level fire activity within containment lines. 
  • Smoke may still be visible to surrounding communities.  
  • Crews and aircraft will continue to work in the area. 
You should stay informed, monitor conditions and stay away from the area.

To help ensure the safety of our emergency personnel do not fly drones over the fire area. 

Slow down to a speed that enables you to stop safely when you see emergency services working beside the road. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 

Road closures
All roads are now open. 
40km per hour speed restrictions are in place for the following roads:
  • Creswick-Dean Road between Melbourne Road and Skilbecks Road
  • Melbourne Road between Creswick-Dean Road and Russells Reservoir.   
Forest Tracks
Internal forest tracks in the fire area remain closed including Bush Inn Road.

Replacement fencing information
  • Farm fencing adjoining state or national parks:
The Victorian Government will pay half of the cost of boundary fencing upgrades, up to $5,000 per kilometre to replace or repair fencing between private land and all national parks and state forests destroyed or damaged by bushfires.

  • Farm fencing destroyed by firefighting activities:
The Government will pay 100% of the restoration costs of fences damaged on private land as a result of machinery used by fire agencies to control bushfires, or fire agency staff cutting through fences to allow access for suppression efforts.

The Department of Energy, Environment and Climate Action (DEECA) will assist assessing your property before works are undertaken or any payments are made. Landholders can call find more information on the Department of Energy Environment and Climate Action website or by calling the Contact Centre Team on 136 186, Monday to Friday, 8:00am to 6:00pm

Water replacement 
Any water from your property used by emergency services will be replaced. Find out more information about how to request replacement water on the Department of Energy Environment and Climate Action website or by calling the Contact Centre Team on 136 186, Monday to Friday, 8:00am to 6:00pm

Your water tank before and after fires
If your tank water has been affected by fires you may need to get a tank clean. 
To find out more about keeping your tank water healthy and safe before and after fires visit the Better Health website. 

Recovery information 
If you are a resident with questions about recovery after this fire contact: community recovery@hepburn.vic.gov.au or call 5348 2306.

Djuwang Baring, Creswick Trails is now open. 

Firefighting vehicles and machinery will be moving around in the area.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 21/12/2024 12:10 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Barton, Moyston, Willaura, Willaura North.

  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control.
  • The northern end of the bushfire continues to burn north in the Serra Range and toward the Major Mitchell Plateau. 
  • The southern end of the bushfire continues to burn toward Bornes Hill. 
  • A south-westerly change is expected in the early afternoon and will shift the fire to the north east.   
  • Burning operations conducted today may create increased smoke.  

There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighters are are responding to this fire.
  • Smoke will visible from nearby communities and roads
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
 
Road Closures:
  • Grampians Tourist Road is closed from Bellfield entrance to the southern Victoria Valley Road intersection. 
  • Victoria Valley Road is closed at the Victoria Point Intersection. 
  • Yarram Gap Road is closed from Grampians Tourist Road to Moyston-Dunkeld Road.
 Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

Grampians National Park visitor information and closures: 
The southern part of the Grampians National Park remains closed. This includes sites in the Major Mitchell Plateau, Serra Range and Victoria Range.

For further details please visit the website: Parks Victoria - Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park 

This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 20/12/2024 07:20 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/35093/moreinfo

This Advice message is being issued for Barton, Moyston, Willaura, Willaura North.

- There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control.
- The northern end of the bushfire continues to burn north in the Serra Range and toward the Major Mitchell Plateau. 
- The southern end of the bushfire continues to burn toward Bornes Hill. 
- A south-westerly change is expected in the early afternoon and will shift the fire to the north east.   
- Burning operations conducted today may create increased smoke.  



There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: areas surrounding the Grampians National Park
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for smoke in areas surrounding the Grampians National Park.

  • You may see or smell smoke in your area that is a result of the bushfire in the Grampians National Park. 
  • Smoke can be carried long distances in the atmosphere and may drift far wider than the area indicated in blue on the map. 
  • Changes in wind direction will alter the locations most affected by smoke. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
What you should do:

  • Your nose is an excellent smoke detector. If you can smell smoke, take the necessary precautions to protect your health. You can self-assess the air quality near you using https://www.epa.vic.gov.au/for-community/environmental-information/air-quality/smoke/smoke-your-health.
Take action to reduce your exposure to smoke and protect your health: 
  • Everyone should minimise the time spent in smoky conditions whenever practical to do so.
  • People over 65 years, children 14 years and younger, pregnant women and those with existing heart or lung conditions, should reduce prolonged or heavy physical activity. Where possible (and not under direct threat from fires), also limit the time spent outdoors and when indoors, close windows and doors. If there is a break in smoky conditions, open the windows and air out your home.
  • Anyone with a heart or lung condition should take their medication as prescribed. People with asthma should follow their personal asthma action plan, continue to take preventer medication as prescribed and keep reliever medication on hand.
  • If you or anyone in your care is worried about symptoms, seek medical advice or call Nurse on Call on 1300 60 60 24.
  • Anyone experiencing difficulty breathing or tightness in the chest should seek urgent medical assistance and call Triple Zero (000).
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

Updates to this smoke message will be made if the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.  
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

The Threat is Reduced following the bushfire at 2.5 Km North Of Hotspur. 

  • This Advice message replaces the 'Stay Informed' message.
People located within the area are now able to resume normal activities.
Impacts in your area:
  • Emergency services will remain in the area.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.  

This will be the final message issued for this fire unless the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Jimmy Creek, Mirranatwa, Bornes Hill, Grampians, Victoria Valley
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Bornes Hill, Grampians, Jimmy Creek, Mirranatwa, Victoria Valley. 

  • It is strongly recommended you Prepare to Leave. 
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road. The bushfire is not yet under control.
  • The northern end of the bushfire continues to burn north in the Serra Range and toward Major Mitchell Plateau. 
  • The southern end of the bushfire continues to burn toward Bornes Hill. 
  • A south-westerly change is expected in the early afternoon and will shift the fire to the north east.  
  • Burning operations conducted today may create increased smoke. 
  • Smoke will be visible to surrounding communities.
  • Crews and aircraft continue to work in the area.

Prepare to Leave immediately. Leave as soon as you are ready, as roads will become busy as people leave.
What you should do:
  • Monitor the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can mean the situation is worsening.
  • Protect yourself and your family.
  • If you are not prepared, leave now. Don’t wait until it is too late - leave early. 
  • If you are away from home, do not return.
If you are leaving, pack: 
  • Cash 
  • Clothing for three days 
  • Medicine for three days 
  • Phone and chargers 
  • Toiletries 
  • Important documents 
  • Meaningful items and photos 
  • Pet essentials, including leash and carriers.
Check on your neighbours if it is safe.

Check the VicTraffic website for road closures.

Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 

Where to go:
  • Friends or family away from the fire. 
  • Consider roads may become busy closer to the time of impact. 
Impacts in your area:
  •  Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds.
  •  Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
Road Closures: 
  • Grampians Road, is closed from the Bellfield Entrance to the southern Victoria Valley Road intersection. 
  • Victoria Valley Road is closed at the Victoria Point Intersection. 
  • Yarram Gap Road is closed from Grampians Road to Moyston-Dunkeld Road.
Check the Vic Traffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

Grampians National Park visitor information and closures: 
The southern part of the Grampians National Park remains closed. This includes sites in the Major Mitchell Plateau, Serra Range and Victoria Range. 

Check the Website for details: Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 20/12/2024 05:20 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
